com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.interfaces

Interface ReceivingService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable, SoftStoppable

    public interface ReceivingService
extends Runnable, SoftStoppable
    The ReceivingService class is the entry-point for receiving objects, that are sent over the network.

    This Runnable is meant to be run in a separate Thread and to be (sort of) forgotten about. It is used within a Connection.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • cleanUpCallBacks

        void cleanUpCallBacks()
        This method cleans up all save CallBacks, leached to this ReceivingService.

        Calling this Method, will clean out all Callbacks, that return true on Callback.isRemovable()

      • addReceivingCallback

        void addReceivingCallback(Callback<Object> callback)
        Adds a Callback, that will be handled internally
        Parameters:
        callback - the Callback, that should be used

      • setup

        void setup(Connection connection,
           Session session)
        Sets up internal Components.

        It is therefore branded to the provided Connection and Session. This is needed for the CommunicationRegistration

        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection, this ReceivingService listens to
        session - the Session, this ReceivingService listens to

      • setSession

        void setSession(Session session)
        Sets the Session.
        Parameters:
        session - the Session

      • onDisconnect

        void onDisconnect(Runnable runnable)
        Sets what to do, if the ReceivingService is disconnected
        Parameters:
        runnable - the Runnable, that should be run if this disconnected

      • started

        Awaiting started()
        Returns a synchronization mechanism, that will stop blocking if this is listening
        Returns:
        the internal Synchronization mechanism

      • isSetup

        boolean isSetup()
        Returns whether or not, this ReceivingService is safe to run.
        Returns:
        true if setup(Connection, Session) has been called, else false
        See Also:
        setup(Connection, Session)
